newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore noon shares down, Venture soars.
newsitem.headline: Singapore noon shares down, Venture soars.

text.p: Singapore shares were mostly lower on profit taking on Friday morning, but electronics related stocks powerered on upwards.

Dealers said the hottest stock of the day was electronics contract manufacturer Venture, which rocketted more than 30 percent to a new high of Singapore $6.75 after announcing it was launching a new multi-media software.
It eased back to S$6.60, up S$1.45 with 1.81 million shares traded.
An analyst with a British house said the new product would lift earnings but the sharp jump in the share price was a "knee jerk" reaction.
Creative Technolgy shares had roller-coaster session after the Venture news on fears that its business would be affected.
But analysts said the two companies were making different products and aimed at different ends of the market. Creative recovered from a low of S$34.80 to stand at S$36.00 at noon, down 50 cents.
Other electronic stocks also gained, including Sunright, which hit a new year high of S$3.00.
The SES electronics index touched a new high of 156.85 before easing slightly to 156.79, up 6.19 points.
But the wider market was lower with index-linked stocks falling in moderate volumes. The Straits Times Industrial index was down 7.07 points at noon at 1,974.21.
Cerebos and Fraser & Neave shed 10 cents each to S$5.70 and S$10.50 respectively.
Total market volume was 172.8 million units with 213 losers outpacing 139 gainers.
